content.description: A short route with cool moves but it is marred a little by it's short length and it's position on the hillside. Not a bad warm up as far as getting you out of your head and waking your body up to movement.
content.location: On the left side of the buttress walk all the way up to the top of the hill and look for this lil 2 bolter.

content.description: A fantastic route deserving of traffic. gotta be able to crimp but don't forget to bring your slab game for the upper half. Classic granite movement.
content.location: On the left side of the buttress this is the direct (left) line off of the mutual start for the two harder routes.

content.description: Crimp straight up to a nice left hand hold and then traverse straight to the right on a steep slab. The climbing is so deviously technical it is hard to imagine. The sequence is impossible to remember completely but it so fun! The falls are cush. The thing is a must do for a granite slab master.
content.location: Start up the mutual start on the left side of the buttress and break hard right for 25 feet before going up again.

content.description: A wild route that has a lot of climbing in it's short length. Fun at times and brutal as well. Stretch or jump to the rail. Move left to the crux. Small holds on steep rock to gain a mid way jug. One more slightly easier boulder problem gets you to the top. watch your back on the tree behind you. You can extend the last bolt down to clip it from the jug if you want to reduce the tree danger.
content.protection: 4 bolts if you count the directional for the belayer to a ring anchor,
content.location: The first route you see when you get to the cliff. look for the horizontal rail and the bolt line.

content.description: This is the finger of rock that points down toward the boulderfield. Mostly harder climbs on high quality Waterville granite. Home to the hardest route in the area to date, Axiom 5.13c, a steep double boulder problem on a rope. On the other side of the buttress two classic 5.12s on perfect stone.
